text: Does anyone know if it is possible tointegrate a search into HubSpot that can search within PDF documents as well, to serve the right content. So a user searchs a term and if it exists in a PDF also this is served in the search results
You wouldn't want that for downloadable PDFs such as ebooks. This would let people skip the form.
I agree but its  client request and they want the content to then be downloaded via a form
But to show in results

Is it possible to use HTML in the inline thank you box for default HubSpot Forms? I just want to display a video on submission alongside the thank you message, but don't really want to take them to another page for it.

Hi Community,
Anyone experience this before and aware of a better option?The issue is with a RSS feed.

I have been trying some things out with placing html in the xml-feed for the events of a newsletter. First of all, it doesn't seem to work to put divs etc inside the xml-code since HubSpot automatically put all items from the RSS on a new row in the newsletter. The problem is  RSS feed  gets put on different rows through <table>-tags, so we cannot place the items next to each other this way

<http://cultuurwerkt.wezz.io/feed.html>

As a last resort it seems I would have to trying to put this code directly in the editor by pasting the HTML-source(Hoping to avoid this option)
Anyway to get it to look like this?<http://tinypic.com/r/34fo8s6/9>
HubSpot search cannot do that.
You would be better to inline some of the content on the page.
Hi - is there a way to have 3 columns break to 2 columns then 1 instead of the default 3 -> 1? I have 3 equal width flex columns in a row with custom modules in them
either make your css declarations more important than the default HubSpot css or make a custom module with your own rules
i would opt for the latter
Ok thanks!
Weird problem here...for the selector <button> on my site, I am using ::before and ::after to get the styling I want.
however...in a rich text module, all the editing options, when buttons, get this styling applied...
I have a feeling my editors aren't gonna be happy with this....
what a color palette...
also let this be another poke to get markdown for blog content editing...

lol nice.

Yea looks like css leakage there
Is this kind of thing on me to worry about or should I report a bug? still getting comfortable with do's/don'ts for HS

I’d report the bug.
It shouldn’t be doing that.

I mean you could solve your own problem by targeting a class or something that’d be on all your pages  like .body-container-wrapper but to be honest it’s kinda their fault for allowing the css to leak
yeah, its kinda funny how it keeps bleedin through
alright, here's the post for it <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/CSS-Leak-Bug-on-Rich-Text/m-p/268485#M12116>
It took me a few minutes to understand what i was looking at... I thought you covered up the screen shot of the design manager for privacy.
:stuck_out_tongue:

That's the best place to get some help. We do have a few developers who monitor the forums full-time (although on a Friday night it may take a little time to get a response).

I'm not technical enough to solve this one - otherwise I'd hunt around to try and help. (sorry).

You could also try calling into the HubSpot Support - they may be able to help quicker... just depends on how deep the bug goes - they aren't developers so their technical knowledge will only go so far. They may suggest posting in the developer forum (which you already did) - but worth a shot!
Going to repost this in <#CJ5DN6RKP|email-development> :slightly_smiling_face:
ha <@U22PKFRU5> Technically I did...inadvertently with my css!
Add an example link
its in the DM when editing a rich text module. <@UD53A9UUR> whats the best way to link for that?
Oh. Only in the dm?
yeah. because the css gets pulled in to preview text in the rich text editor, any option/editing window that pops open seems to pull in the css too, thus grabbing the styles for <button>
So all is good on the front end?
yeah, all good there
That is beyond The forum.
Will need the big kids for that

lol
